title: AD: Gundy exit in best interest of OSU long-term
content: Hours after Oklahoma State announced the firing of longtime football coach Mike Gundy amid a 1-2 start, athletic director Chad Weiberg emphasized the decision was made with the "best interest of moving the program forward in the long term."

title: Sources: OU's Mateer breaks hand, out a month
content: Sooners quarterback John Mateer will undergo hand surgery for an injury suffered in the first quarter of last week's win over Auburn. Mateer, an early Heisman favorite, is expected to return this season, the school said.

title: Parsons on sacking Dak: 'It's going to be painful'
content: Sacking Dak Prescott would be bittersweet for Micah Parsons, who told The Associated Press that sacking his former teammate and mentor is "going to be painful."

title: Skubal, Tigers collapse; caught by Guardians
content: Ace Tarik Skubal fell apart on the mound in Cleveland on Tuesday night and Detroit fell to its seventh straight loss, allowing the Guardians to catch the Tigers in the standings and secure the tiebreaker.

title: Sources: Giants to bench QB Wilson, start Dart
content: The Giants are planning to bench quarterback Russell Wilson in favor of first-round rookie Jaxson Dart after three games, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Tuesday.

title: Alabama's Latham hospitalized with neck injury
content: Alabama's Jah-Marien Latham is being evaluated at a hospital in Birmingham, Alabama, after suffering a neck injury in practice Tuesday, and Crimson Tide coach Kalen DeBoer later said in a statement that the linebacker had "full feeling and motion."

title: Guardians' Fry hospitalized after fastball hits face
content: Guardians DH David Fry was taken to a local hospital after being struck in the face by a 99 mph fastball as he tried to bunt Tuesday night against the Tigers.

content: Our experts weigh in on the No. 1 pick of the 2025 NBA draft and what type of fantasy production they expect out of him as a rookie.

title: 'Putin was lying to Trump': Zelenskyy reacts to US president's U-turn on Russia war
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy expressed surprise at Donald Trump's changed stance on the Russia war, noting improved relations between the US and Ukraine. Zelenskyy believes that President Putin's repeated dishonesty towards Trump has strengthened the bond between their nations. He highlighted enhanced intelligence coordination as crucial for battlefield decisions.

title: Is Sanju Samson the weakest link in India‚Äôs middle order?
content: Sanju Samson scored a scratchy 45-ball 56 on a sluggish Abu Dhabi pitch against Oman and looked all at sea during his 17-ball stay at the crease against Pakistan in Dubai. He struggles when the ball gets soft, and with Jitesh Sharma waiting in the wings, it will be interesting to see how long India persist with Sanju Samson.

title: Glitch or a snub? UN escalator stops the moment Trump & Melania step on it - Watch
content: President Trump dismissed escalator and teleprompter malfunctions at the UN, but the White House demanded an investigation, suspecting sabotage amid funding tensions. UN officials attributed the escalator stoppage to a safety mechanism, while Trump joked about the incidents. The White House views the incidents with suspicion, especially after reports of UN staffers joking about embarrassing Trump.

title: 'Suspected affair': Man stabs wife 11 times to death in public view;
content: In Bengaluru, Lohithashwa, 43, surrendered to police after fatally stabbing his 32-year-old wife, Rekha, a telecaller, near Sunkadakatte. Rekha, previously married with two daughters, married Lohithashwa a few months ago. He suspected her of infidelity and was upset that she wouldn't send her daughters away.

title: Cyber fraud case: Sudha Murty targeted; scammer posed as DoT official
content: Philanthropist and Rajya Sabha MP Sudha Murty recently fell victim to cyber fraud. She received a call from someone posing as a Department of Telecommunications official, claiming obscene videos were linked to her mobile number. The scammer threatened to disconnect her services. Murty has filed a police complaint, and investigations are underway. Authorities advise caution and never sharing personal information.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for September 24- check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mehul Kothari from Anand Rathi Shares recommends buying Greaves Cotton, Vadilal Industries, and Capri Global. Greaves Cotton shows a symmetrical triangle breakout with a target of ‚Çπ275. Vadilal Industries exhibits an inverse head and shoulder breakout, aiming for ‚Çπ7,000. Capri Global presents a range breakout with momentum confirmation, targeting ‚Çπ215.

title: Bangladesh coach fires warning ‚Äì 'Every team can beat India'
content: Bangladesh coach Phil Simmons asserts that no team should fear India ahead of their Asia Cup Super Fours clash, emphasising that victory depends on the day's performance. He praised his team's preparation and fitness to handle back-to-back matches, highlighting their consistent approach to T20 cricket. Simmons remains unfazed by criticism, focusing on the team's confidence and strategy.

title: 'Hope we can fix': US secretary Rubio on India tariffs after Jaishankar meet
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio hinted at a potential reconsideration of tariffs imposed on India for Russian oil purchases, following discussions with S Jaishankar. Rubio emphasized the need for stronger European sanctions against Russia.

title: ‚ÄòWe need the brightest minds‚Äô: Nvidia, OpenAI CEO defend H‚Äë1B fee; warns US
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman have both expressed concerns over the recent H-1B visa fee hike, emphasizing the importance of attracting global talent to the U.S. Huang highlighted immigration as the foundation of the American Dream, while Altman focused on streamlining the process to secure the smartest individuals.

title: Asia Cup: Pak beat SL to keep India vs Pakistan final hopes alive- Scenarios explained
content: Pakistan's crucial win against Sri Lanka keeps the Asia Cup 2025 final berth hopes alive, setting the stage for a potential India vs Pakistan showdown. With India leading the Super Fours, a win against Bangladesh secures their spot and turns Pakistan vs Bangladesh into a virtual semi-final. However, a Bangladesh upset would keep all four teams in contention.

title: 'Aimless war': Trump says Ukraine 'can win'; calls Russia 'paper tiger'
content: Donald Trump has asserted that Ukraine, backed by the EU and NATO, could potentially reclaim its territory, criticizing Russia's war effort as 'aimless'. He highlighted Russia's economic struggles, suggesting Ukraine should act now. Trump also supports NATO shooting down Russian jets violating their airspace, affirming a strong stance towards the alliance, while remaining non-committal on direct US action.

title: 57 yrs after soldier forced out, widow gets pension
content: The Armed Forces Tribunal (AFT) has directed the government to release arrears of invalid pension to Lance Naik Umrawat Singh's widow from 1968 and family pension from 2011, nearly 57 years after his medical invalidation.

title: US H-1B $100K fees: Netflix founder calls it ‚Äútax"; fears will end lotteries
content: Netflix co-founder Reed Hastings supports Donald Trump's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, a move that contrasts with the widespread criticism from Silicon Valley leaders. While Hastings believes the fee will ensure H-1B visas are reserved for high-value jobs, the White House clarified it's a one-time payment for new petitions only, causing confusion and concern among tech companies, especially startups.

title: Brain-eating amoeba in Kerala: Cases spark concern; experts debate rise vs detection
content: Kerala is facing a rise in brain-eating amoeba infections, but increased detection efforts, including CSF analysis, explain the surge in reported cases. While the condition has a high mortality rate globally, early diagnosis and treatment in Kerala are improving outcomes. Prevention focuses on avoiding nasal exposure to contaminated water sources, as amoebae are widespread and difficult to eliminate entirely.

title: NBA trade rumours: Celtics eye $24.3m Jazz duo; Simons emerges as key asset
content: The Boston Celtics are reportedly considering a significant roster shakeup to address their center position woes. With Al Horford's expected departure and Kristaps Porzi≈Üƒ£is' exit, the Celtics are eyeing a trade with the Utah Jazz. The proposed deal would send guard Anfernee Simons to Utah in exchange for Walker Kessler and Jusuf Nurkiƒá, bolstering Boston's rim protection and interior defense.

title: Rise of Rishad Hossain - From 'spinner hunt' to Bangladesh's trump card
content: Bangladesh‚Äôs 2017 ‚Äúspinner hunt‚Äù uncovered a teenage Rishad Hossain, who has since evolved into the country‚Äôs brightest wrist-spin prospect. Once ordinary, his discipline and learning curve turned him into a key T20 bowler.

title: Super Typhoon Ragasa: At least 14 dead after Taiwan barrier lake bursts
content: Super Typhoon Ragasa triggered the bursting of a barrier lake in Taiwan's Hualien County, resulting in at least 14 fatalities and 18 injuries. Rescue teams are actively searching for approximately 30 missing individuals after the floodwaters washed away a bridge and inundated a nearby town. Over 7,600 people were evacuated across Taiwan due to the typhoon's impact.

title: Ryan Routh convicted: Trump assassination plotter tries to stab himself in court
content: Ryan Routh was convicted for plotting to assassinate Donald Trump and then attempted to stab himself in the neck with a pen in court. The incident occurred after the jury's verdict, prompting intervention by US Marshals. Routh faces a life sentence, while his daughter was removed from the courtroom after protesting the proceedings.

title: 'It's all too much': Travis Kelce faces pressure over Taylor Swift engagement & tough NFL season
content: Travis Kelce faces intense scrutiny. His engagement to Taylor Swift amplifies media attention. Kelce juggles football, endorsements, and acting aspirations. Sources say he feels pressure. There is fear he might buckle. His demeanor shows strain during games. Media constantly hounds him about his relationship. Kelce's fame impacts his interactions. People closely watch if he handles the pressure.

title: IND vs PAK: After Haris Rauf, Faheem Ashraf also caught making '6-0' gesture - Watch
content: Following Haris Rauf's controversial gestures towards Indian fans, Faheem Ashraf is now under scrutiny for a similar "6-0" taunt during the Asia Cup clash. This action has intensified criticism of Pakistani players for mixing political references with cricket.

title: Ranthambore tiger surveillance goes dark as 11 of 12 cameras conk out
content: Ranthambore Tiger Reserve's high-tech surveillance system, costing approximately Rs 65 crore, has largely failed, with only one of twelve cameras currently operational. Technical glitches and insufficient maintenance have rendered the system redundant, hindering its ability to track tigers and prevent poaching. The failure raises concerns, especially given the suspicious disappearance of five tigers in recent years.

title: 'Jolly LLB 3' box office collection day 5: Akshay, Arshad-starrer crosses Rs 65 cr
content: Akshay Kumar and Arshad Warsi's 'Jolly LLB 3' witnessed a decent opening, grossing ‚Çπ12.5 crore on its first day. Positive word-of-mouth fueled a significant 50% growth on Saturday, followed by further gains on Sunday. Despite an expected Monday dip to ‚Çπ5.5 crore due to Navratri festivities, the film rebounded on Tuesday, earning ‚Çπ6.5 crore, benefiting from discounted ticket rates.

title: NHL trade rumors: Luke Hughes holdout continues; preseason drama continues
content: Luke Hughes, a top defensive prospect for the New Jersey Devils, is currently holding out. He remains unsigned as preseason begins. Contract negotiations are ongoing for a long-term deal. Both sides disagree on the average annual value. NHL insider Elliotte Friedman discussed the situation. The Devils aim to manage cap flexibility. Hughes is committed to the Devils organization.

title: Asia Cup: Pakistan survive Hasaranga spell to beat Sri Lanka and stay alive
content: Pakistan defeated Sri Lanka by five wickets in a crucial Asia Cup Super 4 match, chasing down a target of 134. Wanindu Hasaranga's fiery spell caused trouble, but Hussain Talat and Mohammad Nawaz guided Pakistan to victory. Earlier, Pakistan's pacers restricted Sri Lanka to 133, with Shaheen Shah Afridi taking three wickets.

title: Gisele Bundchen opens up on finding about Tom Brady‚Äôs secret child
content: Gisele Bundchen, Tom Brady's ex-wife, revealed her initial devastation upon learning about Brady's child with his ex-girlfriend early in their relationship. She considered ending things but ultimately they married in 2009. Bundchen fondly recalled their instant connection and constant communication. After 13 years of marriage, the power couple divorced in 2022.

title: Kirk threat, missing stalker: Taylor Swift on alert; Kelce busy with NFL
content: Taylor Swift's security team is on high alert as her alleged stalker, Brian Jason Wagner, has disappeared despite a restraining order. Wagner's evasion of authorities and unsettling behavior have prompted heightened security measures, including covert operations at public events. Swift's team prioritizes her safety above all else, adjusting promotional plans and routines until the matter is resolved.

title: 'Don‚Äôt feel pretty': Madison Beer opens up on struggles with beauty standards
content: Pop star Madison Beer is rumoured to be dating Los Angeles Chargers quarterback Justin Herbert, following her recent split. Spotted together and with Beer attending Herbert's games, speculation is rife. Beer has openly discussed her insecurities about her looks and past mental health struggles, including leaked photos and record label issues.

title: Pre-marriage talk: Savannah James sets boundaries; ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt call me wife,' she tells LeBron
content: Savannah James revealed on her podcast that she wouldn't allow LeBron James to call her "wifey" before they were married, emphasizing the importance of earning the title. She recalled being pregnant at 16 and the challenges they faced. Despite rumors, the couple, who married in 2012 after dating for years, remains deeply in love and supportive of each other.

title: US visa row: Lawmakers move to protect 'dreamers'; lifeline for 1.34 lakh Indian kids
content: A bipartisan group of US lawmakers has reintroduced the America's Children Act, aiming to provide a pathway to citizenship for over 250,000 'documented dreamers' who face deportation upon turning 21. The bill seeks to address the issue of children aging out of their parents' visas, particularly impacting the Indian diaspora due to green card backlogs.

title: Did Keanu Reeves marry Alexandra Grant? Actor reacts to marriage rumours
content: Reports claimed Keanu Reeves secretly married Alexandra Grant in Europe. However, Reeves' publicist denied the rumors. They clarified that the couple is not married. Grant recently celebrated Reeves' birthday with a heartfelt message. The couple has been dating since 2018 and went public in 2019. Their relationship grew stronger during the pandemic.

title: Trump Florida shooting case: Ryan Routh guilty of attempting to kill US President
content: Ryan Routh was found guilty by a jury for attempting to assassinate Donald Trump at his Florida golf club. Routh, who defended himself, faced multiple federal charges related to the incident. Prosecutors argued Routh meticulously planned the attack, while Routh claimed a crime didn't occur as he never pulled the trigger.

title: Small mom-and-pop stores struggle to pass on GST gains
content: Small retailers in India are struggling to immediately pass on GST rate cuts to consumers due to existing stock purchased at old rates, impacting their margins. Awareness of the changes is also a challenge in smaller towns. Companies are communicating revised rates, but implementation faces logistical hurdles, with new packs expected by mid-October.

title: Nobel Prize for Trump? Macron sets one condition; what he said
content: Emmanuel Macron stated that Donald Trump's Nobel Peace Prize hinges on resolving the Israeli-Palestinian conflict in Gaza. Trump claimed to have ended seven wars, including conflicts involving India and Pakistan, asserting his deservingness of the prize for each. Despite endorsements from some nations, the Nobel Committee maintains its selection is based solely on merit.

title: 'Nation that bombs own people': India tears into Pakistan at UNHRC
content: India strongly criticised Pakistan at the UNHRC for misusing the platform with unfounded accusations. India's representative urged Pakistan to address its internal issues, including its struggling economy, military control, and human rights abuses. India also reiterated its stance on the Council's need for impartiality and universality, advocating for dialogue and cooperation over biased mandates.

title: IPR Gandhinagar team proposes roadmap for India‚Äôs fusion power plans
content: Controlled fusion can only happen in extreme conditions, the kinds that exist inside stars. There are currently two popular ways to achieve this: inertial confinement and magnetic confinement. India is already invested in the magnetic confinement technique as a member of the ITER project, which is building a reactor in France

content: The first tip-off came from an alert auto driver in Tiruchi who led the police to unravel a gang involved in abduction and illegal adoption of babies

content: Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami reiterated that those involved in exam malpractices will not be spared under any circumstances.

content: They say that this is posing risk to motorists and causing inconvenience to pedestrians; they urge Greater Chennai Corporation to clear the stretches before the onset of Northeast monsoon

title: Compensation for onion crops should reach tenant farmers, says APTFA
content: Many onion farmers have not been issued tenant recognition cards due to restrictive provisions in AP Crop Cultivators Rights Act, it says

title: IMD warns of heavy rain in Andamans due to cyclonic circulation
content: Local port warnings have been issued in the wake of the weather system, which is likely to cause heavy rainfall till September 25

title: Watch: From villain to legend: Mohanlal wins Dadasaheb Phalke Award
content: Malayalam superstar Mohanlal has been honoured with the Dadasaheb Phalke Award at the 71st National Film Awards, recognising his extraordinary four-decade career spanning nearly 400 films across five languages.

title: Allahabad High Court stays EOW probe against 558 aided madrassas in Uttar Pradesh
content: The petition added that the Act clearly states that the commission shall not inquire into any matter after the expiry of one year

title: Rain a routine fear in Hyderabad‚Äôs flood-prone Hakeempet
content: The area‚Äôs steep gradient, with sharp drops in elevation, funnels rainwater at destructive speed while narrow drains and unplanned construction block natural flow; even brief rain spells often turn the streets into torrents

title: Supreme Court directs Himachal Pradesh government to be clear on its disaster management measures
content: The order comes against the backdrop of landslides and flash floods which have wrecked the State. In a series of questions, the top court has directed the State government to place on record various details, including on green cover and zoning, if any, done on the basis of seismic activity/ landslides/ green cover/ eco-sensitivity

title: Incessant rain, waterlogging in Kolkata leaves Durga Puja pandals damaged, submerged in water
content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee cancelled her Durga Puja pandal inauguration programme on Tuesday, and asked people to remain alert

content: The party urged the Government of India to vote consistently in support of Palestine at the United Nations and to extend humanitarian assistance to Palestinians

content: The Supreme Court is hearing a reference on whether judicial officers with seven years‚Äô legal experience can avail Bar quota for District Judge appointment

content: Move comes after several highway sections were washed away following cloudbursts and floods in Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand

content: The candidates who have been shortlisted can participate in the web counseling round, which will remain open until September 24, till 2 p.m.

title: Bihar polls: INDIA bloc to release manifesto for Extremely Backward Classes
content: The manifesto is likely to include a promise to bring a law for the EBCs on similar lines as the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act.

content: At National Day function,  Xu Feihong says trade between the two countries is up 10%, while 2,65,000 visas were issued to Indians this year

title: Rajnath Singh inaugurates India‚Äôs first overseas defence facility in Morocco
content: The facility will produce the indigenously developed Wheeled Armoured Platform (WhAP) 8x8, jointly designed by TASL and India‚Äôs Defence Research and Development Organisation

title: India to submit updated carbon-reduction targets by the beginning of COP30 on November 10
content: The Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs) are renewable-energy adoption goals set by a country as part of being a signatory to the Paris Agreement ‚Äì under which countries must regulate their fossil fuel consumption to keep the globe from heating 2¬∞C, and as far as possible, 1.5¬∞C above that in pre-industrial times.

title: Andhra Pradesh Assembly¬† passes Bill for Sub-Classification of Scheduled Castes to ensure fair reservation distribution
content: The legislation formalises the Governor‚Äôs 2025 ordinance, dividing the State‚Äôs 59 Scheduled Castes into three groups. It follows a Supreme Court ruling upholding sub-classification and aims to provide equitable access to education and public employment

title: Manish Tewari‚Äôs comment on ‚ÄòGen Z revolts‚Äô triggers exchange of words with BJP
content: BJP terms it a hidden comment on Congress‚Äôs leadership by Gandhi family; Tewari says his remarks should not be viewed as Congress versus BJP, but has serious national security implications for the country

content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan also direct the officer to come up with an action plan to supply safe drinking water

content: To simplify fund flow and enable local communities to take financial decisions, World Bank funds will be channelled directly to the councils under Tamil Nadu Coastal Restoration Mission

title: YouTuber‚Äôs interfaith marriage faces rough weather; parents allege kidnap, girl deny charge
content: The interfaith marriage of YouTube comedian Khwaja Bande Nawaz Mahammad Hanif Shirahatti alias Mukaleppa three months ago has run into rough weather. The girl‚Äôs family has lodged a complaint accusing him of forcibly marrying their daughter after ‚Äúkidnapping and brainwashing‚Äù her, an allegation which has been rubbished by the girl

title: Caracal, MEIL firm Icomm Tele combine bag contract to supply 200 CSR 338 sniper rifles to CRPF
content: Delivery of Caracal‚Äôs first India-produced CSR 338 sniper rifles is scheduled for the fourth quarter of 2025

title: Customs seizes 36 vehicles suspected to have been smuggled in from Bhutan
content: The operation, codenamed Numkhor (meaning vehicle in Bhutanese language), saw Customs teams fan out across the State based on a list of 150 to 200 vehicles flagged for irregularities in the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways database and suspected to have been smuggled into Kerala through a Coimbatore-based smuggling network

title: Watch: Who is responsible for addressing the potholes issues in Bengaluru?
content: Bengaluru is facing a big pothole problem, with over 1,500 being filled daily. Citizens, IT companies, and the opposition are demanding quick action as poor roads disrupt traffic and business.

title: Bihar Minister sends ‚Çπ100 crore defamation notice to Prashant Kishor
content: Last week Mr. Kishor had accused the Minister Ashok Choudhary of the Janata Dal (United) of having amassed assets worth over ‚Çπ200 crore in two years.

title: 46 more villages added to Local Planning Area of Hubballi Dharwad development authority
content: The Urban Development Department has issued a notification newly including the villages to the Local Planning Area of the HDUDA

title: Visakhapatnam Steel Plant will not be privatised, says Nara Lokesh
content: The IT Minister credits the double-engine government for supporting the plant‚Äôs revival, and highlights new investments and job creation initiatives in the State

title: School students to compete for ‚Çπ1 crore prize money pool in Viksit Bharat Buildathon contest
content: Two-hour livestreamed innovation event on October 13; students asked to ideate and build prototypes by end of October; winners to be announced at district, State, national levels

title: Telangana seeks 70% share in Krishna water allocated to combined A.P.
content: Minister for Irrigation Uttam Kumar Reddy says strong arguments were placed before KWDT-II with scientific data

title: Immigration Crackdown To Tariffs: How Americans Rated Trump Policies
content: As US President Donald Trump completed eight months in the White House, Americans graded his second presidency based on his top policies, including his crackdown on immigration, crime, and imposition of tariffs.

title: In Rain-Hit Kolkata, Life Far From Normlacy, Days Before Durga Puja
content: Life in Kolkata remains out of gear even 24 hours after heavy overnight rain left the city waterlogged ahead of the Durga Puja extravaganza. At least 10 people have died in rain-related incidents, while the City of Joy braces for more showers.

title: A Look At Trump's Second-Term Media Fights, Including Jimmy Kimmel
content: President Donald Trump's contentious relationship with US news organisations has led to a host of legal battles and disputes, the latest of which came with ABC's suspension and - days later - return of the "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" show.

title: India, China Should Not Allow Boundary Dispute To Define Ties: Chinese Envoy
content: Chinese Ambassador to India Xu Feihong noted that despite ups and downs, China-India relations have been "overwhelmingly defined by friendly cooperation" and stressed the need to strengthen dialogue, trade, and exchanges.

title: 'Climate Change Greatest Con Job Ever': Trump Praises "Clean, Beautiful Coal"
content: President Donald Trump used his UN comeback address Tuesday to champion fossil fuels and deride green technologies on the eve of a climate summit called by Secretary-General Antonio Guterres to galvanize countries into issuing updated emission-reduct

title: Tamil Nadu Student Stripped, Hit With Slippers At Hostel; 3 Minors Detained
content: A student was stripped and humiliated by a group of fellow students at a government hostel in Tamil Nadu's Madurai, said the police, adding that three juveniles have been taken into custody for subjecting the student to ragging.

title: Accused In 'Cash-For-Vote' Case Seeks Action Against Chandrababu Naidu, Revanth Reddy
content: A letter written to Supreme Court by an individual who identifies himself as an accused and victim in 'Cash-for-Vote' case has made allegations and demanded action against Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu and Telangana CM Revanth Reddy

title: 'You All Are Going To Hell': Trump Slams UN, Western Nations Over Migration
content: US President Donald Trump relentlessly mocked the United Nations on Tuesday in his first address since his White House comeback, blasting it for failing to bring peace and claiming the world body encourages illegal migration.

title: US Seeks Probe As Escalator, Teleprompter Malfunction During Trump UN Visit
content: President Donald Trump appeared to laugh it off Tuesday when an escalator and a teleprompter both malfunctioned during his United Nations visit -- but for US officials it was no laughing matter.

title: Jimmy Kimmel To Be Back On Air But Still Face Partial Boycott
content: Jimmy Kimmel's late-night talk show will be back on the air in the United States Tuesday after a week-long hiatus following government pressure on broadcasters that critics said amounted to a chill on free speech -- but it won't be on everywhere.

title: UN Believes It Has Solved The Abrupt Stopping Of Trump's Escalator
content: The United Nations believes it has solved the mystery of why an escalator abruptly stopped shortly after U.S. President Donald Trump stepped onto it on Tuesday - his videographer may have accidentally triggered a safety mechanism.

title: Amid Strict US Visa Rules, Trump Invites Global Fans To World Cup, Olympics
content: U.S. President Donald Trump told the UN General Assembly on Tuesday that he hopes "countless people from all over the globe" will attend the 2026 World Cup and 2028 Olympics hosted by the US.

title: Jill Biden's Ex-Spokesperson Claims 'Mean Girls' Culture Dominated White House
content: A former press secretary of Jill Biden, the wife of former US President Joe Biden, has criticised their administration and the work environment they forged during their time at the White House.

title: Zelensky Urges China To Pressure Russia To End Ukraine War
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky told the UN Security Council Tuesday that China could pressure Russia to end the war in his country, following a US call for Beijing to stop buying Moscow's oil.

title: South Korea Vows To End "Unnecessary Military Tensions" With North Korea
content: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung vowed on Tuesday to end a "vicious cycle of unnecessary military tensions" with North Korea, with the aim of achieving peaceful coexistence and shared growth.

title: NATO Must Shoot Down Russian Jets Violating Territory, Says Trump
content: US President Donald Trump said Tuesday that NATO nations should shoot down Russian planes violating their territory, as he met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on the sidelines of a UN summit.

title: Italian Cinema Queen Claudia Cardinale Dies At 87
content: Sixties screen siren Claudia Cardinale, who died on Tuesday aged 87, entranced audiences across the globe with the sultry gaze that made her the muse of Luchino Visconti and Federico Fellini.

title: Hindu Population Declined Due To Foreign Invasions, Colonial Rule: Yogi Adityanath
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said that centuries of foreign invasions and colonial rule in India not only led to the exploitation of resources and people but also caused a significant decline in the Hindu population.

title: "Only Possible If...": What Macron Said On Trump's Nobel Prize Ambitions
content: If U.S. President Donald Trump really wants to win the Nobel Peace Prize, he needs to stop the war in Gaza, French President Emmanuel Macron said on Tuesday.

title: Schools Shut, Flights Cancelled As Typhoon Ragasa Heads To Hong Kong, China
content: Hong Kong and parts of southern China were on high alert early Wednesday as Super Typhoon Ragasa approached with powerful winds and lashing rain, forcing Chinese authorities to shut down schools and businesses in at least 10 cities.

title: WWE Raw takeaways: Are Ripley and Sky WWE's new odd couple? Can Vaquer keep ascending?
content: the first Raw after Wrestlepalooza left the landmark event firmly in the rearview mirror . attention turned to building the card for crown jewel in Perth, Australia, on Oct. 11 . newly minted women's world champion Stephanie Vaquer delivered a heartfelt promo after it was announced she would square off with the winner of this Friday's triple-threat match .

title: Ten years of Kirby Smart at Georgia
content: a stranger approached a football coach to share a story about her daughter . she stepped outside to hear smart screaming at his players through a microphone during practice . the woman said she felt so much better that she wasn't in football practice, she said .

title: Futures of Giants' Brian Daboll, Joe Schoen hinge on Jaxson Dart's instant success
content: the new york Giants will start rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart in week 4 . the decision came down after coach Brian Daboll left the door open to a change on Monday . he will start until the Giants couldn't justify him being the starter .

title: Micah Parsons isn't the first player Jerry Jones talked contracts with -- he won't be last
content: it has been a common practice for Jones and executive vice president Stephen Jones over the years to engage with their star players in hopes of convincing them to sign a new deal . there is nothing in the collective bargaining agreement that explicitly prevents the discussions . several agents said it is not a good look to circumvent them and go to the player who might not know all the details .

title: No, Indiana football hasn't really beaten anyone, but what if it's for real?
content: Indiana dropped 35 first-half points against a top-10 opponent previously hyped for its defense . a 63-10 annihilation of the no. 9-ranked Illini, a prime-tieti-ranked, was a show of force against the top-10 . the former mausoleum known as IU's Memorial Stadium is a combination of delirium and disbelief .

title: MLB playoff pressure rankings: Which World Series contenders must win now -- or else?
content: the Padres beat the Brewers 5-4 in the playoffs . the answer is a little different for every team, and the force of that pressure changes with each passing season . only the faithful are in a state of pure release, because L.A. won last year .

title: Texans release S Gardner-Johnson after 3 games
content: Texans release safety C.J. Gardner-Johnson in surprise move . texans traded 2022 first-round pick to the Philadelphia Eagles in march . coach deMeco Ryans' defensive scheme has contributed to several big plays this season .
